H0.text: Skin cells are the type of cells that pass on mutations.

H1.text: Nerve cell is the type of cell that passes on mutations.

H2.text: Red blood cells pass on mutations.

H3.text: The egg cell is the type of cell that passes on mutations.

A4.text: Recombination of the genes during meiosis ensures that the chromosomes of gametes are not exact duplicates of either of the sets of chromosomes carried in the parental diploid chromosomes but a mixture of the two.

A5.text: In contrast to a gamete, which has only one set of chromosomes, a diploid somatic cell has two sets of homologous chromosomes
